summary: Email correspondence between Assistant U.S. Attorney Maurene Comey and expert witness Dr. Kimberly Mehlman-Orozco regarding her potential testimony in the United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell trial. The emails discuss scheduling a call and exchanging CV and fee information.

persons.name: Kimberly Mehlman-Orozco
persons.context: Contacted by prosecutors to discuss testifying at the Ghislaine Maxwell trial; provides CV and fee schedule.

persons.name: Maurene Comey
persons.context: Prosecutor in the United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell case; initiates contact with expert witness.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, scheduled for trial.

connections.description: Prosecutor contacting potential expert witness for trial testimony.
Expert witness being considered to testify in the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Scheduled trial date for United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Original scheduled trial date for the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell in the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Expert witness consultation scheduled
events.description: Prosecutors schedule a call with Dr. Kimberly Mehlman-Orozco to discuss her potential testimony as an expert witness.

keyFacts: Prosecutors in the Ghislaine Maxwell case were actively seeking expert witnesses for trial as of October 2020.
The trial was originally scheduled for July 12, 2020, but this email exchange occurred in October 2020, indicating a delay.
Dr. Kimberly Mehlman-Orozco was contacted as a potential expert witness and provided her CV and fee schedule.
The correspondence shows prosecutorial preparation for the Maxwell trial involving multiple AUSAs.
